summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: The After Review Date: 2015/01/31 Categories: Science Fiction Product Description: ['A new Amazon Original Series: From Chris Carter, creator of The X-Files. Eight strangers are thrown together by mysterious forces and must help each other survive in a violent world that defies explanation. More episodes coming soon exclusively on Prime Instant Video.'] Average Rating: 3.8 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Chris Carter'], 'Producers': ['Chris Carter', 'Marc Rosen', 'Gabe Rotter'], 'Starring': ['Aldis Hodge', 'Andrew Howard', 'Arielle Kebbel']} Review Text: I really wanted to like this. But this isn't a show so much as a series of somewhat related scenes.

A rather attractive woman gets nude after IT happens (whatever IT is)...so if that's your thing, at least there's that. To be clear...the girl skinny dips in front of strangers after IT happens because....ratings?

I guess ratings are immaterial here. But it's just a very strange thing to shoe-horn into a show about the end of the world.

Anyway, cliches ahoy, matey! I think we pretty much have every modern stereotype covered here, and it's all terribly boring.

This show is like The Walking Dead with a much smaller budget, worse actors, a much smaller budget and a terrible script.

If you do watch it, consider it a comedy going in and you might enjoy it. Review Title: I really wanted to like this. But this isn't a show so much ... That seems really weird and irresponsible. It's an extra person that the soldiers have to babysit. Review Title: Great film, but why was the son allowed to ... Review Title: Good if you're doing research for fiction or something else Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/09/28 Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert Kiviat'], 'Producers': ['Robert Kiviat', 'Antonio Bardales', "James 'Jim' Courant", 'Don Ecker', 'Sean Fanton', 'David Kiviat', 'Matthew Kleinman', 'David Rajter', 'Jeff Sagansky', 'Scott Silver'], 'Starring': ['Buzz Aldrin', 'Mike Bara', 'Joshua P. Warren'], 'Studio': ['Gaia']} Review Text: Meh. The woman is trying to explain to them that the "pipe" or "bridge" is just a lava tube or molten rock formation (The moon used to be part of the earth) but they are ignoring her. This is bad documentary film making. They are literally just speaking over her with their own interpretations. Why even bother bringing in an expert to look? Review Title: This is bad documentary film making Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/10/01 Average Rating: 3.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ellen Goosenberg Kent'], 'Starring': ['Andrea Yates'], 'Studio': ['Fisher Klingenstein Films']} Review Text: Tough one. She was acquitted in 2007 by reason of insanity. That should have been the first verdict. She was clearly quite insane Personally, I think the husband is more to blame than she is. He was an enabler. That female prosecutor clearly has no experience with mental illness. Review Title: Good episode, tragic case. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/10/03 Average Rating: 3.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ellen Goosenberg Kent'], 'Starring': ['David Koresh'], 'Studio': ['Fisher Klingenstein Films']} Review Text: Tough one. The government overreacted, but those people were definitely brainwashed, and it was hardly fair to the kids. Good documentary. Review Title: Good documentary. De la Pena', 'Walter Koenig', 'Chris Judge'], 'Studio': ['Distribber']} Review Text: Really, really bad. The 5 star reviews are clearly from people associated with the production. Family/friends, etc.

Don't waste your time. Sad to see Chris Judge and Koenig getting roped into this. Review Title: Not worth a watch Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/08/17 Average Rating: 3.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch [UT]', 'Español (Latinoamérica) [CC]', 'Español (España) [CC]', 'Français [CC]', 'Italiano [CC]', 'Português [SDH]'], 'Directors': ['Frida Barkfors', 'Lasse Barkfors'], 'Producers': ['Frida Barkfors', 'Anders Bruus', 'Anne Köhncke'], 'Studio': ['Journeyman Pictures']} Review Text: So yeah, this is depressing. But it's objectively a good documentary. The white dude in the beginning definitely should have done *some* time. That's just blatent negligence. Talk about white privilege. (I'm white). Review Title: Good documentary, but sad Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/08/17 Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert McCallum', 'Jordan C. Morris'], 'Producers': ['Robert McCallum', 'Jordan Christopher Morris', 'Marc Almond', 'Matt Miller', 'Sarah Mulholland', 'Kelly Tessier', 'Rodney Waschka II', 'Tim Wendel'], 'Starring': ['Robert McCallum', 'Chris Byford'], 'Studio': ['Pyre Productions']} Review Text: I enjoyed it fine while watching it, but looking at the reviews afterward I have to agree with the points made in the 1 star reviews. The mom wasn't 'missing.' She walked out on her two kids and chose to not make contact again. She was found in a few days and wasn't living far from her parents. She wasn't abducted or anything like that as the title would imply.

There is little to no mystery here. It's a feel-good documentary, but it has very little substance.

I seriously wonder what awards this could have won. Review Title: Suprising Depth Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/05/13 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English [Audio Description]', 'ಕನ್ನಡ', 'Italiano', 'Deutsch', 'தமிழ்', 'עברית', 'Indonesia', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Tiếng Việt', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Ελληνικά', 'తెలుగు', 'Français (France)', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Français (Canada)', 'Filipino', '日本語', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Nederlands', 'മലയാളം', 'Español (España)', 'हिन्दी', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Türkçe', 'ไทย', 'Română'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية (العالم)', 'العربية (مصر)', 'Català', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Euskara', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français (Canada)', 'Français (France)', 'Galego', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'ಕನ್ನಡ', '한국어', 'മലയാളം', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', 'Українська', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Douglas Mackinnon'], 'Producers': ['Rob Wilkins', 'Chris Sussman'], 'Starring': ['Michael Sheen', 'David Tennant', 'Jon Hamm'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: I would give 3.5 stars if that was an option.

It's a good watch if you have a sense of humor and some imagination. But I'm taking a point off for the Adam sub plot. The kids are well cast, but the acting is meh and the dialogue is very cringe.

I'm taking a further half point off for the overall quality. It's...quite uneven. Overall, it's okay. But the there is a lot of deus ex machina, and sometimes nothing makes any sense. Things just kind of happen. Then the narrator comes in and explains it...as if that's good story telling. "Now this happened, so just accept it and move on." This is typical of Mr. Gaiman's stories, but it works better on the page. On TV, it just makes you say, "Wait...what?"

Finally, the gender swapping (from Biblical texts) gets to be a tad on the nose. 1 or 2 changes is innovative...by 4 and 5, they're just trying to trigger the anti-SJWs. It's obnoxious. I'm not Christian and don't care at all about that part of it...but it is kind of obvious that they are trying to piss a certain demographic off. Just stop. Review Title: Imaginative but Uneven Rating: 3.0 --------------------------------------------------

Review Title: Suprising Depth Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/05/13 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English [Audio Description]', 'ಕನ್ನಡ', 'Italiano', 'Deutsch', 'தமிழ்', 'עברית', 'Indonesia', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Tiếng Việt', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Ελληνικά', 'తెలుగు', 'Français (France)', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Français (Canada)', 'Filipino', '日本語', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Nederlands', 'മലയാളം', 'Español (España)', 'हिन्दी', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Türkçe', 'ไทย', 'Română'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية (العالم)', 'العربية (مصر)', 'Català', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Euskara', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français (Canada)', 'Français (France)', 'Galego', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'ಕನ್ನಡ', '한국어', 'മലയാളം', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', 'Українська', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Douglas Mackinnon'], 'Producers': ['Rob Wilkins', 'Chris Sussman'], 'Starring': ['Michael Sheen', 'David Tennant', 'Jon Hamm'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: I would give 3.5 stars if that was an option.

It's a good watch if you have a sense of humor and some imagination. But I'm taking a point off for the Adam sub plot. The kids are well cast, but the acting is meh and the dialogue is very cringe.

I'm taking a further half point off for the overall quality. It's...quite uneven. Overall, it's okay. But the there is a lot of deus ex machina, and sometimes nothing makes any sense. Things just kind of happen. Then the narrator comes in and explains it...as if that's good story telling. "Now this happened, so just accept it and move on." This is typical of Mr. Gaiman's stories, but it works better on the page. On TV, it just makes you say, "Wait...what?"

Finally, the gender swapping (from Biblical texts) gets to be a tad on the nose. 1 or 2 changes is innovative...by 4 and 5, they're just trying to trigger the anti-SJWs. It's obnoxious. I'm not Christian and don't care at all about that part of it...but it is kind of obvious that they are trying to piss a certain demographic off. Just stop. Review Title: Imaginative but Uneven Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- Structure your response as: SUMMARY: [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual displays a nuanced preference in their viewing habits, oscillating between admiration and disappointment in their ratings, with a clear inclination towards thought-provoking content, particularly in science fiction and documentaries. The purchase history reveals a trend towards critically evaluating productions based on their narrative depth and quality, favoring well-crafted storytelling over superficial elements. 

There is a consistent engagement with themes of societal critique, mental health, and ethical considerations in real-life scenarios. This suggests a preference for content that stimulates discussion around complex issues rather than mere entertainment. 

Quality seems to take precedence over price, as indicated by high ratings for shows towards which they showed a favorable disposition, regardless of potential cost. Conversely, low ratings highlight a sensitivity to poorly executed scripts and predictable narratives, leading to strong negative reactions towards perceived clichés and shallow storytelling.

Overall, this individual exhibits a critical yet open-minded approach, often enjoying shows that blend humor with substantive themes while expressing frustration towards works perceived as lacking depth or originality. Their desire for engaging, well-written narratives imbued with authenticity defines their core preferences.

target_interaction.title: Endlessly Fascinating, but frustrating
target_interaction.text: This show comes precariously close to pointless mystery box territory. But ultimately, it's an entertaining mind f!ck. It will make you think. It will also likely frustrate you. I wanted more story and a bit less 'then this happens.' I'd watch a season 2, but I won't hold my breath for substantial answers. It's almost like if the Twilight Zone pretended to have a plot.
